timeline.message: feat: Dynamically generate list of detector status codes during doc generation.
refactor: Cleaned up directory object hierarchy.
feat: Created DetectorStatusCode with set of previously generated status codes as its initial value set.
feat: Detector status codes are defined as an enum.
feat: Update docs to list possible detector status codes.
refactor: Moved DetectorStatusCodeTest to correct package.

timeline.bodyText: I feel like this comparison is not correct.
timeline.author: taikuukaits

timeline.bodyText: In the case resultClass is null, we could return this.getClass();
timeline.author: taikuukaits

timeline.bodyText: Then we wouldn't need to do this.
timeline.author: taikuukaits

replies.bodyText: what do you mean by this?
replies.author: crowleySynopsys

replies.bodyText: Sorry, I mean that if we return this.getClass() then we shouldn't need to use this constructor because it would return this class.  When is the result class different from this.getClass()? Is that when we wrap an underlying detectable result?
replies.author: taikuukaits
